qas.question: Detroit Medical Center has become a part of what Health System?
How much does Vanguard plan to invest in DMC?
What is a name of a Catholic hospital in Detroit?
How much will Vanguard spend to retire debt for DMC?
How much does Vanguard plan to spend in capital investment?

context: Detroit Medical Center formally became a part of <a0_0>Vanguard Health Systems<a0_0/> on December 30, 2010, as a for profit corporation. Vanguard has agreed to invest nearly <a1_0>$1.5 B<a1_0/> in the Detroit Medical Center complex which will include <a3_0>$417 M<a3_0/> to retire debts, at least $350 M in capital expenditures and an additional <a4_0>$500 M<a4_0/> for new capital investment. Vanguard has agreed to assume all debts and pension obligations. The metro area has many other hospitals including William Beaumont Hospital, <a2_0>St. Joseph's<a2_0/>, and University of Michigan Medical Center.
